meta-review.comment:
Hippo Penny - I've got a review that's so good, it'll make you want to grab some popcorn, sit back, and get ready for a thrilling ride! (Sorry, had to start with something fun)

Okay, let's dive in and see what the critics have to say about Capes. First up, IGN gave it an 80%, saying that "Capes' clever and challenging take on superhero-flavored turn-based tactical combat gives you all of the information you need to turn the tables on its villains." Yeah, yeah, we get it - they like the game!

But what about Worth Playing? They also gave Capes an 80% and said it's "just fun. If you like XCOM but wanted your heroes to have more power from the get-go, Capes scratches that itch incredibly well." See, I told you they'd agree on something!

Now, Vandal decided to keep their review short and sweet (or not so sweet, depending on how you look at it). They gave Capes a 70% and didn't bother explaining why - maybe they were too busy being cool and mysterious?

Moving right along, Hardcore Gamer gave Capes an 80% and raved about the "vibrant visuals" and "intricate gameplay mechanics." Yeah, yeah, we get it again - they love the game! But then they had to go and mention some minor issues with audio-visual sync and balance quirks in the combat system. Party pooper!

PC Gamer also gave Capes an 80% and said it's one of the best turn-based strategy games of recent years... even with that awkward story. We're not sure what to make of that, but hey, at least they liked the game, right?

And then there's GameStar, who decided to keep their review brief (or maybe just didn't care). They gave Capes a 67% and didn't bother explaining why - maybe they were too busy playing video games or something?

Last but not least, The Games Machine gave Capes an 83% and said it's the perfect game for those looking for a level of challenge similar to that of any XCOM. Yeah, yeah, we get it again! They love the game, and who can blame them? It sounds like a lot of fun!

So there you have it - my review of Capes is over, but I hope yours hasn't ended just yet!
